1.text: Hear ye now what Jehovah said: Arise, contend thou with the mountains, and the hills shall hear thy voice.

2.text: Hear ye mountains the contention of Jehovah, and ye perpetual foundations of the earth: for a contention to Jehovah with his people, and he will dispute with Israel.

3.text: My people, what did I to thee? and in what did I weary thee? answer to me.

4.text: For I brought thee up from the land of Egypt, and from the house of servants I redeemed thee; and I shall send before thy face, Moses, Aaron and, Miriam.

5.text: O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab counseled, and what Balaam son of Beor answered him from the acacias even to Gilgal; in order to know the justice of Jehovah.

6.text: With what shall I come before Jehovah? I will bow to the high God; shall I come before him with burnt-offerings, with calves, the sons of a year?

7.text: Will Jehovah delight in thousands of rams, in ten thousands of torrents of oil? shall I give my first-born my transgression? the fruit of my belly, the sin of my soul?

8.text: He announced to thee, O man, what was good; and what did Jehovah require of thee but to do judgment and to love mercy, and being humbled, to go with thy God?

9.text: The voice of Jehovah will call to the city, and wisdom feared thy name: hear ye the rod, and who appointed it.

10.text: Are there yet treasures of injustice in the house of the unjust, and the ephah of leanness being cursed?

11.text: Shall I make clean with the balances of injustice, and with the bag of stones of deceit?

12.text: For her rich ones were full of violence, and her inhabitants spake falsehood, and their tongue of deceit in their mouth.

13.text: And also I made sick, striking thee, making desolate for thy sins.

14.text: Thou shalt eat and not be satisfied; and thine emptiness in the midst of thee; and thou shalt remove and shalt not deliver; and what thou shalt save I will give to the sword.

15.text: Thou shalt sow and thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olive and thou shalt not anoint thyself with oil; and new wine, and thou shalt not drink wine.

16.text: The laws of Omri will be observed, and all the work of the house of Ahab, and ye will go in their counsels; so that I shall give thee for a desolation, and her inhabitants for hissing, and ye shall bear the reproach of my People.
